title: Reports; monitoring of guardianship
context: ยง560:5-317 Reports; monitoring of guardianship. (a) Within thirty days after appointment, a guardian shall report to the court in writing on the condition of the ward and account for money and other assets in the guardian&rsquo;s possession or subject to the guardian&rsquo;s control. A guardian shall report at least annually thereafter and whenever ordered by the court. The report shall state or contain: (1) The current mental, physical, and social condition of the ward; (2) The living arrangements for all addresses of the ward during the reporting period; (3) The medical, educational, vocational, and other services provided to the ward and the guardian&rsquo;s opinion as to the adequacy of the ward&rsquo;s care; (4) A summary of the guardian&rsquo;s visits with the ward and activities on the ward&rsquo;s behalf and the extent to which the ward has participated in decision-making; (5) If the ward is institutionalized, whether the guardian considers the current plan for care, treatment, or habilitation to be in the ward&rsquo;s best interest; (6) Plans for future care; and (7) A recommendation as to the need for continued guardianship and any recommended changes in the scope of the guardianship. (b) The court may appoint a kokua kanawai to review a report, interview the ward or guardian, and make any other investigation the court directs. &copy; The court shall establish a system for monitoring guardianships, including the filing and review of annual reports. [L 2004, c 161, pt of ยง1]
